title: Meghan Markle stuns in her go-to monochromatic look for fall
text:
WINDSOR, UNITED KINGDOM - OCTOBER 25: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex and Prince Harry, Duke of Sussex attend a roundtable discussion on gender equality with The Queens Commonwealth Trust (QCT) and One Young World at Windsor Castle on October 25, 2019 in Windsor, England. (Photo by Jeremy Selwyn - WPA Pool/Getty Images)

Yahoo Lifestyle Canada is committed to finding you the best products at the best prices. We may receive a share from purchases made via links on this page.

Always a fan of a monochromatic look, Meghan Markle stepped out Friday morning in the perfect autumnal shade.

While continuing her work with One Young World, the Duchess of Sussex made an appearance at a roundtable discussion at Windsor Castle.

Sporting an $815 red leather skirt and matching sweater, the 38-year-old royal reinvented one of her previous looks—she wore a similar forest-green ensemble on an official visit to Sussex in October 2018.

Meghan Markle in red, October 2019 vs Meghan Markle in green, October 2018. Via Getty Images. More

Also making a surprise appearance by her side was Prince Harry, who drove the short distance to Windsor Castle from their nearby home Frogmore Cottage. Ever the eco-warrior, he arrived at the event in his electric car, while baby Archie stayed behind.

The duo met with One Young World Ambassadors and young leaders who are running global projects supporting gender equality and inclusion. ⁣

Meghan’s burgundy outfit consisted of the BOSS Selrita Lamb Leather Pencil Skirt, which retails for $815, and a burgundy Joseph deep V-neck pullover that’s available for a cool $480.

Meghan accessorized her look with a pair of Sarah Flint Perfect Pumps, as well as a collection of dainty gold jewelry. Two standout pieces by Vargas Goteo Jewelry: the Bow Knot Ring and the Gold Manta Kiss Stack Ring, which for every piece sold, $50 is donated to the Manta Trust in support of conservation, research and education.

Meghan’s entire look is still available to shop, but at more than $1,800 for the entire ensemble, it isn’t necessarily the most affordable. Ahead, shop our picks to get a Duchess-inspired look, but at a fraction of the price.

Image via Saks Fifth Avenue More

SHOP IT: Saks Fifth Avenue, $815

Image via Evernew. More
description: Here's how to snag her $815 leather skirt for a fraction of the price.
